newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch PTT buys Belgian distribution firm.
newsitem.headline: Dutch PTT buys Belgian distribution firm.

text.p: Koninklijke PTT Nederlanden NV (Dutch PTT) said on Friday it had bought distribution firm Belgische Distributiedienst, based in Nossegem, Belgium.
The company is an important distributor of mail shots in Belgium, but also offered direct distribution of newspapers and magazines.
The firm has offices throughout Belgium and works closely with 5,000 distributors.
Dutch PTT's postal unit has distribution and logistics affiliates in a number of countries in and outside Europe.
The Belgische Distributiedienst will continue operations under its own name and management. The takeover will not lead to immediate job losses, Dutch PTT said.
"We expect that the Belgische Distributiedienst can continue to grow on the back of the international market position and available know-how of PTT Post," Dutch PTT said.
